R: @chamikaramj PTAL

What is the goal of this change? Specifically, why would users want to disable metrics? If this is a performance consideration, there are two sources of (potential) performance pain:

1. Actually reporting metrics (which I believe this PR addresses)
2. Keeping the MetricsContainer in sync.

In general, if this is something we actually feel is useful, it seems like disabling both of the above as well as making require less runner-specific code, would be worthwhile.
Run Flink ValidatesRunner
LGTM

These definitely add value. Thanks!

LGTM & I will merge to the gearpump-runner branch.

Coverage increased (+0.2%) to 70.66% when pulling **2eaf1aa835f697b97235fa805f5908cd61d0ef54 on reuvenlax:dynamic_writes_in_batch** into **22d84c92c4c005ff58eb425167745ebf4d66de0c on apache:master**.
@tgroh PTAL

To interpret a little bit: you want to make sure we don't make it harder to diagnose problems with ITs. I agree. I also think we want to make sure we are able to diagnose problems with the larger scale (performance) tests. 

To that end, I had planned later work to add in other validation besides the hash where it'd be easier to determine the cause (eg. by outputting the expected/actual rows.) It would do sampling of the data set for detailed comparison/output of results. However, I don't have a detailed plan for that yet, so let me do some work to make that more concrete and add it here, then we can see if you think that'll make it appropriately easy to diagnose ITs.
Sounds right -- happy to merge (or ask another committer) as is or when you're happy with it, now that we're on the same page.

R: @tgroh 

CC: @lukecwik  -- I'll wait for your PR to merge, in case there are conflicts.
Re: Dataflow worker -- not any more; I update the worker in this PR.
